replies.bodyText:
Looks like the java.util.StringJoiner is 2-3x faster than the guava joiner so I'll stick with it.
Time to join 10k and 1 million a characters with a , character:



Number of elements
StringJoiner
Guava Joiner

1 ms
8 ms


1000000

replies.author: jasmith-hs

replies.bodyText: Interesting. Thanks for verifying. The JDK StringJoiner was introduced in Java 8, so maybe it's just historical that we use it. That said, the guava version has some nice features like skipNulls
replies.author: boulter
